intro: Vismia micrantha, commonly known as the small-fruited evergreen, is a tropical plant native to regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when ripe, containing several seeds. Vismia micrantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact size and attractive foliage. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
